About

This application will help you to build a habit of reminding yourself to check if you are sleeping or not. With such habit in place one can remember to make a check while sleeping and realize that he or she is sleeping. By doing so one can increase chances of falling into lucid dreaming.

Application provides collection of great tips about reality checks and lucid dreams in general, check them out by using Next Tip button.


Using random length time periods prevents you from being prepared for notification. Use fixed length time periods to follow your rhythm of sleep.

Background sound is useful to remind you thru dream without waking you up. Choose sound which suits you and adjust volume so that you don\'t wake up. You can use it also during a day to create sub-conscious connection between specific sound and intention.

string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: Perform some simple tasks that rely on basic physics and logic. As you do them, consciously ask yourself if you are awake or dreaming.
Can you hold your nose and mouth shut and still breathe?
When you jump, do you float back down?
Can you read a sentence twice without it changing?
Is your vision clearer or blurrier than normal?
Can you push your right fingers through your left hand?
Can you read a clock face or digital watch?
Can you fly, shape shift, or walk through walls?
Do light switches work properly?
Does your reflection look normal in the mirror?
What day is it and what are you doing now?
Can you add up two numbers for a correct answer?
Besides teaching people how to learn lucid dreaming, reality testing is a great way to increase your self awareness.
You should always test your reality when you wake up, to be sure that it isn\'t a false awakening.
Perform one last check before you go to sleep, while reminding yourself to have lucid dreams tonight.
Some people who learn lucid dreaming decide to write a capital "L" for Lucid on the back of their hand, which reminds them.
Do a reality check every time you perform a certain action, like opening a door, looking at your watch, getting into a car, or walking down the stairs.
If your chosen reality check doesn\'t work while in dream, pick a new one.
When you write, it may be illegible or irregular, and the letters may change.
Look at your self. If you have, for instance, 7 fingers on one hand, you are dreaming.
Use a computer. Do your normal startup programs run? Can you access the internet okay?
Look, use a telephone. Are all the numbers in order? Press the "call" button. Do you get the "boooo" tone?
Jump. Do you float? Do you stay in the air for an abnormal amount of time? Do you hear the "thump" sound when you land?
Throw a soft ball or something of the sort. Does it act as you would expect it to? Does it stay up or move abnormally far?
Spray something or some perfume or just smell something - does it smell as expected?
Recalling dreams also improves chances for lucid dreaming. Try to remember your dreams after you wake up.
Writing your dreams into journal improves chances for lucid dreaming. Try to remember your dreams after you wake up and write them into journal later.
